Row.Text: The Punic Port is a Carthaginian unique building, replacing the Seaport. It forms a [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connection over water to the Capital, extends sea trade route range, and adds 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold when sea trade routes connect to another civilization, more than the Seaport it replaces. The Cothon also grants 15 XP to Naval units and improves [ICON_STRENGTH] City Defense. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be built on the coast.

Forms a [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connection over water to the Capital (if not already connected by land). Sea trade routes orginating from this city have a 50% increase in range and produces an extra 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold when connecting to another civilization. Only Carthage may build it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be built on the coast.

"Of Phoenician origin, the city-state of Carthage was a mighty sea power, with a trading empire stretching across much of the Mediterranean. Carthage's wealth (and survival) depended upon the quality of its navy and merchant fleet. To protect its fleet from attack and the elements, and to improve and speed construction of new vessels, Carthage constructed two artificial harbors ("cothon") in the city, a massive effort that required the excavation of some 230,000 cubic meters of earth. One harbor was for the merchant fleet; the second was for the Carthaginian navy."
